alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 12:57PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Nottoway, southwestern Dinwiddie and northern Brunswick Counties through 130 PM EST... At 1257 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Alberta, or 8 miles north of Lawrenceville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lawrenceville, Alberta, Fort Pickett, Ordsburg, Danieltown, Cochran, Rawlings, Dolphin, Barrows Store, Forkland, Prices Mill and Meredithville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EST for south central Virginia.
